column3: Needs assessments of triggers to identify the need for an EA. (before EA launch)
column4: Disaster Brief done for the  Management Call to inform the FAD between 48-72
column5: EA is launched within 24 hours after the FAD has been approved (or within 48 hours after field report was published).
column7: A resource mobilization plan is developed and approved within 3 to 4 weeks of the EA that looks at long term funding and sustianability.
column8: IFRC advocates with NS  for the approval and use of  Surge or  in country capacity from movement partners within the first  5 days of the trigger
column9: RR personnel Alert sent within 12h of the request
column10: # of RR deployed arriving in country of operation within 4 days from deployment message  - 3 months
column11: Key initial longer-term positions identified by operational leadership and requested via submission in the HR system, one week after the EA publication
column12: Once approved in the HR system and pre-classified JD provided, HR advertises key initial longer-term positions within 48 hours.
column13: Hold a mini summit within 48 h of the disaster
column14: Review/adapt membership coordination framework for the context for this specific emergency
column15: Ensure an appropriate membership coordination framework is in place after 24h of trigger
column16: Initial supply chain plan developed between logs and ops coordinator within 1 week of the approved EA
column17: Fully approved and submitted requisitions for NFIs within 1 week of the EA (when relevant)
column18: First round of payment received to the target beneficiaries four weeks after the EA launch for sudden onset (when relevant and when CVA is planned)
